`-1` for negative numbers, and `0` for `0`.

This theorem states that for any topological space `Î±` and any discrete topological space `Y`, if `Î±` is preconnected and `f` is a continuous function from `Î±` to `Y`, then the function `f` will produce the same output for any two inputs `x` and `y` from `Î±`. This is a version of `isPreconnected.constant` theorem specialized for `PreconnectedSpace`.

type:
âˆ€ {Î± : Type u} [inst : TopologicalSpace Î±] {Y : Type u_3} [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace Y] [inst_2 : DiscreteTopology Y],
  PreconnectedSpace Î± â†’ âˆ€ {f : Î± â†’ Y}, Continuous f â†’ âˆ€ {x y : Î±}, f x = f y
name: PreconnectedSpace.constant
docString: This theorem states that for any topological space `Î±` and any discrete topological space `Y`, if `Î±` is preconnected and `f` is a continuous function from `Î±` to `Y`, then the function `f` will produce the same output for any two inputs `x` and `y` from `Î±`. This is a version of `isPreconnected.constant` theorem specialized for `PreconnectedSpace`.

The theorem `IsPreconnected.image` states that for any two types `Î±` and `Î²`, equipped with their respective topological spaces, and for any set `s` of type `Î±`, if `s` is preconnected and there is a function `f` from `Î±` to `Î²` that is continuous on `s`, then the image of `s` under `f` is also preconnected. In simpler terms, this theorem asserts that the continuous image of a preconnected set remains preconnected.

type:
âˆ€ {Î± : Type u} {Î² : Type v} [inst : TopologicalSpace Î±] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace Î²] {s : Set Î±},
  IsPreconnected s â†’ âˆ€ (f : Î± â†’ Î²), ContinuousOn f s â†’ IsPreconnected (f '' s)
name: IsPreconnected.image
docString: The theorem `IsPreconnected.image` states that for any two types `Î±` and `Î²`, equipped with their respective topological spaces, and for any set `s` of type `Î±`, if `s` is preconnected and there is a function `f` from `Î±` to `Î²` that is continuous on `s`, then the image of `s` under `f` is also preconnected. In simpler terms, this theorem asserts that the continuous image of a preconnected set remains preconnected.

The rank of a module as a natural number.

Defined by convention to be `0` if the space has infinite rank.

For a vector space `M` over a field `R`, this is the same as the finite dimension
of `M` over `R`.

type: (R : Type u_1) â†’ (M : Type u_2) â†’ [inst : Semiring R] â†’ [inst_1 : AddCommGroup M] â†’ [inst : Module R M] â†’ â„•

The rank of a module as a natural number.

Defined by convention to be `0` if the space has infinite rank.

For a vector space `M` over a field `R`, this is the same as the finite dimension
of `M` over `R`.

The highest regular priority for spawned tasks: `8`.

Spawning a task with a priority higher than `Task.Priority.max` is not an error but
will spawn a dedicated worker for the task, see `Task.Priority.dedicated`.
Regular priority tasks are placed in a thread pool and worked on according to the priority order.

type: Task.Priority
name: Task.Priority.max

Spawning a task with a priority higher than `Task.Priority.max` is not an error but
will spawn a dedicated worker for the task, see `Task.Priority.dedicated`.
Regular priority tasks are placed in a thread pool and worked on according to the priority order.
